t: When*pn Ephraim spoke, trembling, He*ld exalted himself*i in Israel; But*ld when he offended through Baal worship,*i he died.

Now*ld they sin more and more, And*ld have made for themselves molded images, Idols*ld of their silver, according to their skill; All*ld of it is*i the work of craftsmen. They*ld say of them, “Let*ld the men who sacrifice kiss the calves!”
Therefore*ld they shall be like the morning cloud And*ld like the early dew that passes away, Like*ld chaff blown off from a threshing floor And*ld like smoke from a chimney.
“Yet*ln I am*i the Lord*s your God Ever*ld since the land of Egypt, And*ld you shall know no God but Me; For*ld there*i is*i no savior besides Me.
I*ld knew you in the wilderness, In*ld the land of great drought.
When*ld they had pasture, they were filled; They*ld were filled and their heart was exalted; Therefore*ld they forgot Me.
“So*ln I will be to them like a lion; Like*ld a leopard by the road I will lurk;
I*ld will meet them like a bear deprived of*i her*i cubs;*i I*ld will tear open their rib cage, And*ld there I will devour them like a lion. The*ld wild beast shall tear them.
“O*ln Israel, you are destroyed, But*ld your help is*i from Me.
I*ld will be your King; Where*ld is*i any*i other,*i That*ld he may save you in all your cities? And*ld your judges to whom you said, ‘Give*ld me a king and princes’?
I*ld gave you a king in My anger, And*ld took him*i away in My wrath.
“The*ln iniquity of Ephraim is*i bound up; His*ld sin is*i stored up.
The*ld sorrows of a woman in childbirth shall come upon him. He*ld is*i an unwise son, For*ld he should not stay long where children are born.
“I*ln will ransom them from the power of the grave; I*ld will redeem them from death. O*ld Death, I will be your plagues! O*ld Grave, I will be your destruction! Pity*ld is hidden from My eyes.”

Though*ln he is fruitful among his*i brethren, An*ld east wind shall come; The*ld wind of the Lord*s shall come up from the wilderness. Then*ld his spring shall become dry, And*ld his fountain shall be dried up. He*ld shall plunder the treasury of every desirable prize.
Samaria*ld is held guilty, For*ld she has rebelled against her God. They*ld shall fall by the sword, Their*ld infants shall be dashed in pieces, And*ld their women with child ripped open.
